Posts.Content: Hi  Just got my results today and am now cancer free, had WLE and 3 lymph nodes removed and they have got all the cancer and it has not spread, the tumour was a little larger than first thought but still grade 1, don't need chem just 15 sessions of radiotherapy and the little orange Letrozole for 5 years so am thrilled today, I can now get my life back on track, apart from the hot flushes I have no more side eefects from the Letrozole, I have been on it for a month now so heres hoping thats all I get, good luck for your results and hope the outcome is a positive one for you. Hugs and prayers to you all Pat xxx

Posts.Title: dressings for rad burns

Posts.Content: Hi Jan Hope you are doing well and had a few questions answered, I had grade 1 invasive breast cancer 22mm tumour along with 2 intermediate DCIS and had a wle and 3 nodes removed on 20th Feb, I am on Letrozole now for 5 years and have to have 15 sessions of radiotherapy and am seeing oncologist next Wednesday so I don't have all the answers for you but be assured you are not alone and you will get the answers, I look at it this way the cancer has now gone and all following treatment is a precaution to make sure it does not return.   I also have had a problem with my breast swelling to size and colour of a black bowling ball 2 days after surgery, I had to have the wound reopened and had  300ml of blood clots removed, I am now having dressings changed by district nurse everyday and have contracted mrsa in the wound just to top it all off so radiotherapy will be put on hold for now .  Please do not let anyone tell you that you have not had cancer, you and we on here all have  even if it is only early stages, it is frightening and lonley and a lot to deal with, I hope all your treatment goes well and that your family and friends are supporting you.  Take care and good luck   Love Pat xxx
Posts.Title: looking for grade 1 to share info

Posts.Content: HI I too was diagnosed last Monday with DCIS and did my share of crying too so I know what you are going through also lost my Mum to lung cancer last November and so wish she was here to hug and comfort me, I see my surgeon on Wednesday to see what surgery etc he is going to do, and of all the types of breast cancer this is the one to have  with the best survival rate. I actually went 16 months ago to see specialist with the same lump but was told that it was just a fatty lump but now I wonder if they had done a biopsy then, if it would have been found then? Try to keep strong and think that this demon is not going to get the better of you, I have found it better to try to carry on life as normal, going to work and decorating, it elps to take my mind off it for a while.  I hope you will be ok and keep writing your thoughts and worries on here as there are people who will help you through. I send you a big cuddle  and keep your chin up Pat xxxx
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi Cupcake I had the same op as you and home same day in Feb, there will be swelling and bruising at the op site but if it gets too big as mine did please telephone your Breast care nurse, I had to have my wound site reopened and 300ml of blood clots removed ( don't mean to scare you) just a word of advice' I found the sports bras from Asda the most comfy to wear. Don't fret about feeling tired and weepy, we have all been there , cry when you want and sleep when you want, you will soon be feeling much better. I still am shattered and could fall asleep standing up at times so I just get on sofa for a hour and have a nap, still weepy at times just let your mind and body heal at its own pace. Good luck to you on your journey and take care Love and hugs Pat xxxx             0
